DTU Eligibility Criteria:
Inclusion Criteria (ALL must apply):
- Stable vital signs
- Initial investigations (Chest X-Ray confirming diagnosis, blood work) available
- Patients who require more than 4 hours of treatment and discharge is anticipated
- Clinical evidence of heart failure
- Previous history of heart failure and likely cause of CHF identified (ie. medication non-compliance) 

Exclusion Criteria (ANY may apply):
- ECG or serum markers suggestive of myocardial ischemia or infarction
- Unstable airway or SPO2 lower than patient’s baseline or less than 92% RA (unless on home O2)
- Concomitant respiratory tract infection
- Other significant co-morbidities requiring intervention
- Clinically significant arrhythmias
- Signs of poor perfusion or unstable hemodynamics
- Sodium level less than 130 mmol, potassium level less than 3.4 or greater than 5.9 mmol/L
- SCr greater than 180 micromol/L, Urea greater than 25 mmol/L , GFR less than 30 mL/min

- Suspected right ventricular infarction
- Recent use of phosphodiesterase inhibitors: within 24 hours for sildenafil [VIAGRA] and vardenafil [LEVITRA] and within 48 hours for tadalafil [CIALIS]
